definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: A not-so-well-known author's first book became a smash hit .
sentences.chinese: 一位不大有名的作者，第一本書轟動一時。

sentences.english: The book which revealed certain court secrets made a noise in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那本揭露宮廷祕密的書曾轟動一時。

sentences.english: This soap opera acts the leading role by Shanghai renowned actor Zhai Naishe, once created a stir.
sentences.chinese: 該電視劇由上海著名演員翟乃社主演，曾轟動一時。

sentences.english: It was a sensational statement at the time.
The book which revealed certain secrets made a noise in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那本披露祕聞的書曾經轟動一時。

sentences.english: It will make a nice row if that comes out.
sentences.chinese: 倘使事情一傳出去，要轟動一時的呢。

sentences.english: I hear the new show is a riot- do let's go and see it.
sentences.chinese: 聽說這出新戲轟動一時，咱們一定要去看看。

sentences.english: Her comfortable life disintegrates as she is resoundingly excoriated by the press.
sentences.chinese: 因爲媒體轟動一時的抨擊，她舒適的生活被粉碎了。

sentences.english: She sang a hit song when strumming on the guitar.
sentences.chinese: 她邊彈奏吉他邊唱起一首轟動一時的歌。

sentences.english: A hit song sublimed her as a star.
sentences.chinese: 一首轟動一時的歌曲使她變成了歌星。

sentences.english: The outrageous book created a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 那部聳人聽聞的書曾轟動一時。

sentences.english: He had a sensation of dizziness.
sentences.chinese: 那部聳人聽聞的書曾轟動一時。
